title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire Friday 6 January 2017 - BBC News
summary: telford tax payers consulted on proposed increase .
hospital staff monitored for stress , as re-organisation plans wait to be signed off .
shrewsbury town and afc telford united set to announce more signings .

documents.title: swindon town 1-1 shrewsbury town
text: swindon town 1-1 shrewsbury town

documents.title: afc telford lose vat court fight
text: afc telford lose vat court fight

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening .

documents.title: weather : warmer weather this weekend
text: the recent cold snap seems to be over and we 're forecast some slightly warmer temperatures this weekend - reaching 9c ( 48f ) in places .
there is a chance of some mist and fog in places too .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: boss the stowaway cat found new home
text: a stowaway cat who travelled 200 miles away from his home has been fostered .
boss was found meowing in the back of a van in swanscombe , kent , on 20 december .
it 's thought he crawled into the vehicle in telford or birmingham .
a big social media campaign followed to find his owner with thousands of people sharing a video but no one has come forward to claim him .
it 's hoped he will be found a new permanent home soon .

documents.title: watch : shrewsbury manager pleased with latest signings
text: shrewsbury travel to swindon this weekend after adding three new faces in the transfer window .

jack grimmer and olly lancashire are both out after up injuries over christmas , but paul hurst has high hopes for his new recruits and has been talking to us about the two latest ones - alex rodman and freddie ladapo .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weak pound 'benefiting dairy farmers '
text: a weak pound in the wake of the brexit vote might be harming some industries , but dairy farmers seem to be benefiting .
andrew bebb , who farms outside shrewsbury , says sterling 's performance against the euro means it 's more expensive for milk processors to import milk .
meanwhile , it also makes british-produced milk and dairy products more competitive price-wise on the continent
mr bebb says he expects milk prices to continue to rise in the coming months .

documents.title: terminally ill man 's right-to-die fight
text: terminally ill man 's right-to-die fight
author: Fergus Walsh
Medical correspondent

documents.title: watch : shropshire man fears becoming 'entombed '
text: the campaign group dignity in dying is supporting shropshire 's noel conway , who is seeking a judicial review of the 1961 suicide act .
he has motor neurone disease , says he fears becoming `` entombed '' in his body as his muscles gradually weaken .
mr conway , wants a doctor to be able to prescribe a lethal dose when his health deteriorates .
author: Fergus Walsh
Medical correspondent

documents.title: breakingterminally ill man launches assisted-dying legal challenge
text: a terminally ill man from shropshire has begun a new legal challenge for the right to die , the first since mps voted against a change in the law .
noel conway , who 's 67 , has motor neurone disease and wants to be helped by a doctor to end his life when his health deteriorates .

mr conway ca n't walk , needs help with eating and breathing and has been told he has less than a year to live , so he wants a doctor to be able prescribe a lethal dose , when life becomes intolerable .
the supreme court rejected a similar legal challenge three years ago and parliament has also rejected proposals to allow assisted dying .
author: Fergus Walsh
Medical correspondent

documents.title: headlines : muller announces further milk price rise ; 'no promises ' over council job cuts ; new signings for shrewsbury and telford
text: our top stories this afternoon :
- muller plans further increase to the amount it pays farmers for their milk
- council can make `` no promises '' over redundancies
- shrewsbury and telford add more players in january transfer window
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers return to action against title-rivals
text: telford tigers return to action after their extended christmas break tomorrow , when they travel to face title-rivals milton keynes lightning .
the tigers are six points clear at the top of the english premier league table , but their opponents have a game in hand on them , so a win for milton keynes could see that big lead disappear .
tigers head coach is aware his side need to come out of the blocks quickly and has had the players training for a full week , to make sure they are ready .
it has been nice to have the break and we might be a bit sluggish to start , but the guys have blown the cobwebs away in training this week . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: milk price increase 'due to market conditions '
text: muller is n't the only dairy company increasing the amount it pays farmers for their milk - the other big players are also doing it and hanwood dairy farmer andrew bebb says it comes down to supply and demand .

he explained that low milk prices in the past have led some farmers to cut production or leave the business altogether , causing a supply-shortage - and the dairy companies are having to pay more as a result , up to 40 pence a litre in some cases , in the run-up to christmas .

documents.title: muller to pay dairy farmers more
text: muller will be paying its dairy farmers a little more for their milk , starting next month .
the market drayton-based company will be paying just over a penny a litre more , saying it wants to pay a competitive milk price to farmers .
it increased the amount it pays them by 2.5p per litre at the beginning of the year and says its suppliers have seen their milk price increase by an average of 45 % since the start of october .
the latest rise means farmers will get 27.5 pence per litre from next month .

documents.title: no promises on further job losses at telford and wrekin council
text: there could be more job-losses at telford and wrekin council , the councillor responsible for finances has warned .
the authority is looking at ways to save between £ 25m and £ 30m from its annual budget and lee carter has said it always had to `` review the position in terms of our workforce '' .

mr carter says the council has cut 1,200 posts since 2010 and that it had tried hard to reduce the impact through voluntary redundancies and `` moving people around '' , but he could n't make any promises for the future .

we 'll do as much as we can to make sure that the effects of this austerity and the savings we have to make has as little impact as possible on our workforce , who day after day come into work and try to deliver for the people of telford . ''

documents.title: watch : loan-striker confident shrewsbury can beat the drop
text: shrewsbury town 's new loan-signing freddie ladapo has n't been at the club very long , but he knows a little bit about league one , having spent the early part of the season on loan at oldham .
and he is confident shrewsbury can stay up .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: headlines : council redundancy warning ; power station optimism ; football clubs add fresh faces
text: our headlines this afternoon :
- `` no promises '' over redundancies at telford and wrekin council
- optimism over future of power station site
- shrewsbury town and afc telford united bring in fresh faces
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: three things you wanted to know
text: three things you wanted to know

documents.title: football : telford sign 18-year-old on month-long loan
text: afc telford united have added to their squad by signing 18-year-old midfielder tony donaldson on a month's-loan from doncaster rovers .
he 'd recently joined rovers on an 18-month contract .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: win your way to the fa cup final # peoplescup
text: sign up to the fa people 's cup and you could win your way on to the hallowed wembley stadium turf at half-time during the fa cup final .
entries are now open and you can find out all the details here .

documents.title: people asked for views on council tax rise proposal
text: council tax payers in telford are being asked if they 'd pay more for the care of vulnerable adults .
the authority says it would put an extra £ 45 a year on the tax paid by the borough 's average band b property and bring in £ 1.8m .
last month , the government announced councils will be allowed to increase council tax by 6 % over the next two years in order to fund social care services .
we 're extremely mindful of the fact that those just above the benefit threshold are really starting to hurt now and their monthly council tax bill is a big outgoing . ''

documents.title: football : shrewsbury confirm freddie ladapo loan
text: shrewsbury town have confirmed the news that slipped out yesterday afternoon - they are signing striker freddie ladapo on a six-month loan from crystal palace .
he has previously been on loan at oldham athletic , where he scored three goals in 15 appearances .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: is notorious wem level crossing no longer a problem ?
text: there was only one incident of trespassing at wem level crossing dealt with by british transport police officers last year , it has been revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: countryfile focuses on shropshire this weekend
text: this weekend 's edition of countryfile is focusing almost entirely on shropshire .
you will be able to see the presenters visit the snailbeach mine , and a holly tree farm in south shropshire .
they will also be paying a visit to the former furbers tyre scrapyard in north shropshire ( above ) to hear how the shropshire wildlife trust is attempting to return it to nature .
the programme will be shown at 18:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: your questions : why have some hay barns got circular openings ?
text: randle cooke used the your questions section of the bbc shropshire web page to ask `` why do hay lofts , usually above cow sheds , or stables , have a circular opening ? ''
we always try to go to local experts for our answers , so we got in touch with the people at the ironbridge gorge museums .

the museums told us the holes are built into the side of barns ( like the one at blists hill victorian museum , above left ) so that loosely bundled bales of hay could be thrown , from a pitch fork , in to the loft .
and in the past , bales were n't rectangular and tidy like they are today , so bundles were less likely to catch on a round hole than one with corners while they were being thrown in .

the museums also said that some barns have smaller holes ( like the one above right ) , near the eaves and these were built to attract owls , in the hope they would control mouse-numbers - and they were known as `` owl holes '' .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : hospital staff stress study ; council job losses possible ; football clubs to make more signings
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- hospital staff monitored for stress
- telford council warns more job losses are possible
- shrewsbury town and afc telford united close in on transfer window signings
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: chess tournament to start in telford
text: more than 120 chess players from all over the country will be taking part in a tournament starting in telford later today .
the three-day competition has a top-prize of £ 1,000 and two grandmasters , keith arkell and mark hebden , will be among those taking part .
the event is taking place at the wrekin housing trust in telford , but some of the top games will be broadcast live on the internet .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain this afternoon
text: temperatures will be a little higher today , but we 're forecast some heavy rain this afternoon .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: hopes that power station will attract businesses and job to the county
text: shropshire council is hoping that businesses will be attracted and jobs created when the ironbridge power station is ready to be re-used .
the plant is currently being decommissioned and decontaminated , after closing a year ago .
the current owner , power company uniper , has been invited to a meeting of local and unitary councillors , where its future should become clearer .
i 'm sure there will be some productive use for the site .
it 's a big chunk of our business rate base as well so we need to get a good industrial usage for that site , which will bring some much needed income for the council . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: where the bbc films in the midlands : interactive map
text: the bbc does n't just film its shows in london , you know .
the corporation has pinpointed where its regional productions are filmed .
check it out below
want to know what @ twitterid filmed in the west midlands in 2016 ?
check out this interactive map to find out !
@ twitterid

documents.title: watch : shrewsbury town 's new winger keen to get started
text: shrewsbury town have made a couple of new signings since the january transfer window opened and we 're expecting confirmation of a third , freddie ladapo , on loan from crystal palace .
yesterday the club revealed it had signed out-of-contract winger alex rodman , and the 29-year-old seemed keen to get started with his new club .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two men are jailed for growing cannabis on an industrial scale
text: two shropshire men have been jailed at stafford crown court for their part in a sophisticated cannabis growing operation .

martin young , 52 , of farm lodge grove , telford and ian locke , 64 , of pine trees , newport pleaded guilty to cultivating cannabis and possessing the drug with intent to supply at an earlier hearing .
it followed police raids on three barns at hoar cross , near burton-upon-trent .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford pensioner had 2,500 child sex images on his computer
text: a telford pensioner was found to have more than 2,500 indecent images of children on his computer after police raided his home , a court heard .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: denial that anti-social behaviour policy is to target rough sleepers
text: shropshire council insists its proposals to bring in new powers to reduce anti-social behaviour in shrewsbury town centre is n't targeting rough sleepers .
an eight-week consultation starts next week with plans to create a public spaces protection order to deal with alcohol-related offences , graffiti and people using the streets as a toilet .
i accept that there will be an impact on them , because clearly rough sleepers are part of the people using the town centre , but it definitely is n't about rough sleepers .
it 's about anyone who uses the town centre . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : hospital staff stress monitoring ; police firearms exercise ; race meeting called off
text: our headlines this morning :
- hospital staff monitored for stress
- police take part in firearms exercise at royal shakespeare company theatre
- ludlow race meeting called off after inspection
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: hospital staff are monitored for stress
text: hospital staff working in shropshire are being monitored for stress as plans to reorganise healthcare in the county wait to be signed off .
the number of workers off with mental health problems from shrewsbury and telford hospital nhs trust has risen in recent years .
alongside muscular conditions , it 's the biggest reason for staff taking time off sick .
we are conscious that our staff are involved in a lot of change , there 's a lot of change going on in our reorganisation , a lot of talk about future change as well .
so we 've developed a programme about the colour of change , which is preparing staff for the emotional journey that they go on through change . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: blue light services team up with the royal shakespeare company
text: police and ambulance staff from the county will take place in a training exercise this weekend at the royal shakespeare company 's world-renowned theatre .
the exercise has been designed to enhance the skills of emergency responders to a major incident involving the criminal use of firearms in a popular , busy , location .
the rsc lent them the theatre for exercise titus , but the police are insisting it 's not in response to any threat .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: racing : today 's meet at ludlow is called off
text: this afternoon 's racing at ludlow has been abandoned .
there was due to be an inspection around now , but after two days of sub-zero temperatures and rain forecast later this morning the meetings been called off already .
author: Sean Fogarty
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: kronospan starts expanding its chirk factory - despite planning permission refusal
text: one of the region 's biggest employers has started building an extension to its factory , despite being refused planning permission .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: health chiefs urge alternative use to swamped a & es
text: health chiefs across shropshire as well as telford and wrekin , are asking people to consider using alternatives to their under-pressure accident and emergency units .

there 's been a massive increase in demand and people suffering from minor illness or injuries are being asked to use options other than a & e to allow the hospitals to focus on those people with serious conditions , who need to be seen urgently .
it comes as a third of the country 's hospital trusts reveal they had to take urgent action to cope with patient numbers last month .
the nuffield trust charity says , at its worst , they could n't provide comprehensive care .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : a & e departments swamped and two men are jailed for growing cannabis on an industrial scale
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- health bosses urge patients to use alternatives to swamped a & es
- hospital staff are monitored for stress as healthcare re-organisation plans wait to be signed off
- two men are jailed for growing cannabis on an industrial scale
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: a chilly start this morning , followed by a cloudy but dry morning .
however , rain and hill fog will spread south-eastwards through the afternoon .
top temperatures of 6c ( 43f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : roadworks may slow your journey
text: there are no incidents to report on the county 's roads this morning , but roadworks may slow your journey .
there are roadworks on the a5 in telford at the limekiln roundabout .
for more information head to the bbc travel page .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or that you 'd like to share with the rest of the county .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : warmer weather on the way
text: we 're forecast another cold night , but it is expected to be a little warmer tomorrow .
the bad news is that we are also expecting heavy rain tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: overnight closures for telford roundabout
text: telford 's shawbirch roundabout is going to be closed overnight for two weeks , starting on monday .
it 's to allow workmen to carry out resurfacing work and the closures will start at 20:00 and end at 06:00 .

the roundabout is one of six being upgraded around the town , and telford and wrekin council says the work is necessary because the roads around them are expected to get busier with the arrival of new homes and businesses .

documents.title: new hotel will offer 'something different '
text: a planned 35-bedroom hotel on the outskirts of shrewsbury will offer `` something different '' to corporate chains , according to the architects .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: telford and wrekin council needs to find up to £ 20m savings
text: telford and wrekin council still need to find £ 15-£ 20m of savings its head of finance has told colleagues at a cabinet meeting .
councilor lee carter said the local authority had already made £ 96m of cuts .
in all , it needs to find a further £ 25-30m savings by 2019 .
a consultation on budget proposals is due to start tomorrow .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury town sign rodman and ladapo
text: shrewsbury town sign rodman and ladapo

documents.title: racing : inspection at ludlow ahead of tomorrow 's meeting
text: the cold weather is causing concern at ludlow racecourse , when an inspection has been called ahead tomorrow 's meeting .
temperatures are expected to dip below zero again tonight and while they are expected to rise tomorrow , we 're forecast some heavy rain .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : shrewsbury sign striker on loan from palace
text: crystal palace striker freddie ladapo is set to join shrewsbury town on loan .
he 's the club 's third signing since the january transfer window opened and has yet to play for the london club , but made 15 appearances for oldham , scoring three goals .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : cannabis factory pair jailed ; staff shortages shut maternity unit ; shrewsbury sign winger
text: our headlines this evening :
- two shropshire men jailed for involvement in cannabis factory
- ludlow maternity unit closed by staff shortages again
- shrewsbury sign ex-notts county winger
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two jailed over 'sophisticated ' cannabis factory hidden in hay bales
text: two men have been jailed for their part in a `` sophisticated '' and `` commercial '' cannabis factory at a farm in staffordshire .

ian locke,64 , of pine trees , newport , shropshire , raymond nicholls , 65 , of barrows lane , birmingham , and martin young , 52 , of farm lodge grove , telford , pleaded guilty to cultivating cannabis and possessing the drug with intent to supply at an earlier hearing .
locke was jailed for two years and three months at stafford crown court with young given a prison term of three years and two months - nicholls is due to be sentenced at a later date .
the men were arrested at brackenhurst farm , newchurch near burton in march 2015 .
stafford crown court heard how police found cannabis plants and packages with a `` retail value '' of £ 278,000 .
police say there was a potential to produce a million pounds worth of the drug .
staffordshire police say the factory , hidden in parts behind hay bales in barns at the farm , had been running for at least two years .
author: Joanne Writtle
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury town insist they listened to fans over new kit choice
text: shrewsbury town insist fans ' views were taken fully into account when choosing the club 's new kit - but admitted the issue could have been handled better .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: ludlow maternity unit hit by staff shortages again
text: ludlow 's maternity unit is going to close again tonight , because of staffing shortages .
it was one of four midwife-led units ( mlus ) to close over night during the christmas holidays , for the same reason .
the mlu will shut at 20:00 this evening and reopen at 08:00 tomorrow and women due to give birth around now have been offered a home birth or a transfer to another hospital .
unfortunately at times when we have staffing issues , such as illness , we have to make temporary changes to ensure the safety of women using the services . ''

documents.title: gritters out again this evening
text: temperatures are set to finally rise above freezing overnight , but the council gritting teams are taking no chances and they 're sending the lorries out this evening .
as always , they 'll be prioritising the main roads and entrances to places like schools and hospitals .

documents.title: football : rodman signing confirmed by shrewsbury town
text: shrewsbury town have now completed the signing of alex rodman .
notts county earlier reported they had released the 29-year-old , who has scored one goal since he joined them in the summer .
the winger has played under paul hurst before , at grimsby town , and the shrewsbury manager is expecting to make more signings before the january transfer window closes .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new powers to combat anti-social behaviour proposed
text: new powers are being proposed to stop anti-social behaviour in shrewsbury town centre and frankwell .

between april and october last year there were over 200 alcohol-related offences reported in these areas and the temporary powers will allow police officers to order people to stop drinking in public spaces .
the police also recorded over 50 complaints of graffiti , over 100 incidents of littering and 17 reports of people using the street as a toilet in that time-period .
over the next eight weeks there 's going to be a public consultation on the plans and if the measures are approved , the powers will remain in force for three years .

documents.title: headlines : move to combat anti-social behaviour ; hare coursing investigated ; shrewsbury sign winger
text: here 's a recap of our headlines this afternoon :
- move to curb anti-social behaviour in shrewsbury town centre
- reports of hare coursing near newport are investigated
- shrewsbury town add ex-notts county winger
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : blue skies over church stretton and telford
text: it might be cold , but we are seeing some brilliant blue skies over shropshire today .
this was taken by a bbc weather watcher just outside church stretton earlier .
and this was taken in telford by another of our weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: overnight m54 slip road closure starts later
text: the eastbound exit slip road at junction 5 of the m54 will be closed overnight for the next three days .
the telford centre exit , heading towards wolverhampton , will be shut while a fence is being repaired .
it 'll close at 22:00 and reopen at 05:00 .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury set to sign midfielder rodman
text: notts county midfielder alex rodman could be shrewsbury town 's second signing of the january transfer window .
the 29-year-old has made 18 appearances for the magpies and has also had spells with newport county and grimsby town .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cold spell coming to an end
text: it 's going to remain freezing in shropshire today , but this cold snap is coming to an end , so enjoy frosty photos like this one while you can .
temperatures are forecast to rise throughout tomorrow and we 'll have a relatively mild weekend .
the bad news is we 're expecting heavy rain instead .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: concern that thousands of extra houses will crowd telford schools
text: education bosses must reveal how demand for extra school places will be tackled when thousands of new homes are built in telford , a councillor has claimed .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers sign all-star netminder
text: telford tigers have signed the 2015 all-star netminder jon baston from basingstoke bison for the rest of the season .

the 22-year-old was a key part of the team 's title-winning side last season and has been brought in to compete with sam gospel as telford attempt to maintain their lead at the top of the english premier league .
the tigers play milton keynes lightning and swindon wildcats this coming weekend .
this is just a smart move for the team to make , to make sure that we have that depth .
we do n't want to go into game without having a quality netminder there . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: classic tractor stripped of parts
text: thieves have stripped a classic tractor of its roof , windows , mudguards , lights and part of the seat .
it was being kept at wistanstow near craven arms and the registration plate was also taken , sometime between tuesday evening and yesterday morning .

documents.title: doctor faces 'rude and abusive ' bookseller
text: a shropshire doctor found himself on the wrong end of an abusive bookseller , the telegraph writes .
steve bloom , who runs the second-hand bookshop bloomindales in hawes , north yorkshire , has been branded `` rude and offensive '' and the subject of more than 20 complaints to the parish council .
the telegraph said market drayton doctor colin bates , visiting the town , complained to the council after being called a `` pain in the arse '' by my bloom for refusing to pay his 50p entry charge .
mr bloom has not commented .

documents.title: reports of illegal hare coursing near newport
text: there have been reports of illegal of hare coursing in the chetwynd aston area over the last two nights .
the police say they are investigating and warn they have the power to seize offenders ' dogs and cars .
since 2005 , hare coursing has been illegal throughout the uk .
the hunting act 2004 makes it an offence to hunt wild mammals with dogs

documents.title: headlines : council confident in child sex abuse measures ; hare coursing reports ; ludlow a 'posh ' baby name
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- child sex abuse measures are working says telford and wrekin council
- reports of hare coursing near newport are investigated
- ludlow on list of top `` posh '' baby names
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: former market drayton defender set to sign for arsenal
text: a former market drayton town defender is set to sign for arsenal for £ 40,000 .
left-back cohen bramall is moving from northern premier league side hednesford town .
the 20-year-old travelled to arsenal 's london colney training ground on thursday with his agent dan chapman , following an initial period on trial .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : a cold day and freezing temperatures this evening
text: temperatures should rise just above freezing this afternoon , but will be dropping back below , later on .
we are also forecast some light cloud overnight .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your photos : more frosty scenes from around shropshire
text: it 's been a cold morning and it 's not going to get much above freezing today .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers near norton ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: changes to council tax support scheme to be discussed
text: people who get council tax support in telford and wrekin will have to pay more under a proposal being discussed by the cabinet tonight .
currently , everyone of working age is expected to pay at least 21 % of their bill but it 's proposed this will go up to 25 % .
if the labour-run council 's cabinet gives it the go-ahead , the idea will go before full council before it comes into force .

documents.title: your comments : posh baby names
text: after discovering ludlow on a list of posh baby names , we thought we 'd ask for other shropshire towns which could make the list .
scott mathers wrote on our facebook page : .
`` i can imagine a posh child called uffington or ruckley .
maybe not quatt though '' .
people have also been calling bbc radio shropshire to suggest acton burnell , picklescott , bicton heath and felton butler .

documents.title: watch : civic society chair talks about former family home
text: plans to demolish part of brogyntyn hall near oswestry have got the backing of the local civic society , and its chair has a special attachment to the building - because members of his family used to live there .
saffron rainey accepts that knocking down the service wing might be the best way to save the ageing structure , which is on historic england 's register of `` at risk '' buildings .

documents.title: plans for chicken sheds near roden
text: plans for four new chicken sheds at roden , between telford and shrewsbury , have been submitted .
the sheds would house about 260,000 birds in total and would be on land currently used for arable farming .
anyone wanting to have their say on the application needs to contact telford & wrekin council before the end of the month .
author: Elaine Muir
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: minor planning application scheme set for go ahead
text: telford and wrekin council 's cabinet is expected to approve a plan to speed up the planning process for simple things like house alterations and small extensions tonight .
residents will only have to get a certificate of compliance rather than go through the full planning process - provided the house is n't in a conservation area , world heritage site or listed .
this will significantly reduce the operating costs of processing such applications and will also simplify and speed up the process for our residents . ''

documents.title: civic society backs brogyntyn hall plans
text: oswestry 's civic society is backing plans to renovate the town 's historic brogyntyn hall - even though it involves pulling down part of the building .
an online petition , against any demolition at the hall , has been signed by hundreds of people .
the hall is on historic england 's `` at risk '' register after lying dormant for over 15 years .
we did n't object on the grounds that if it 's done , it would hold a new life for it , and that is more important .
it 's much better the building has purpose . ''

documents.title: headlines : council to be updated on child abuse measures ; planning scheme ; shropshire town is top baby name
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- child sex abuse measures working , say council
- minor planning application scheme set for go ahead
- ludlow makes it onto the list of top 'posh ' baby names for 2017
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire town is top 'posh ' baby name for 2017
text: ludlow 's finally made it - as a suggestion for a posh baby name .
the society magazine tatler has listed the shropshire town name among the likes of uxorious and npeter ( the 'n ' is silent ) for boys .
girls names include hum , figgy and rara .

documents.title: jail warning for telford man who stamped on woman during party
text: a telford man has been warned that he could face an immediate prison sentence after it was found he stamped on the shoulder of a woman at a party .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather watchers : a very frosty start
text: it 's cold , frosty , icy , and cold this morning .
did i mention it 's cold ?
lots of coming in from our bbc weather watchers capturing this chilly january morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: child sex abuse measures are working , say council
text: telford and wrekin council is confident the measures it 's introduced to tackle child sexual exploitation ( cse ) are starting to work .
councillors will be brought up to date today on the progress they 're making on 38 recommendations .
this latest update reveals three new roles have been filled , including a senior social worker and two cse practitioners .
victims are now able to access a formally commissioned sexual health check and the development of an emotional health and wellbeing service is on track to go live in may .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : councillors to hear latest on child abuse measures ; missing girl appeal ; hall plans backed by society
text: our top stories this morning :
- measures to tackle child sex exploitation in telford are working , say council
- police appeal for missing 15-year-old girl
- oswestry civic society backs plans to renovate grade ii listed brogyntyn hall - even though it involves part demolition
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your very chilly thursday forecast
text: it 's a bitter start to the day , with temperatures well below freezing .
charlie has the details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : slow through cold hatton heath
text: roadworks on the a442 at stars lane in cold hatton heath are causing delays this morning .
you can check the latest travel news for shropshire here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all of your news , sport , travel and weather updates this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd like to share with the rest of the county .
you can email , tweet or get in touch via facebook .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : freezing temperatures forecast overnight
text: it 's going to be a cold night , with temperatures forecast to drop below freezing and it will remain cold throughout tomorrow .
shawbury is expected to see temperatures fall to -5c ( 23f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police investigating sutton hill attack to stage walk-through
text: the police will be out in the sutton hill area of telford this evening , hoping to up information about an attack on a 65-year-old man a week ago .
they were called to a report of three men , armed with a hammer and knife , assaulting the man after demanding money from him .

the victim was left in a serious condition in hospital and while he is now said to be recovering , the police say he has been left shaken and had money , two coats and a knife similar to the one above stolen .
a 20-year-old man from telford has been arrested on sus of aggravated burglary , he has been released on bail until 1 february .

documents.title: support for shropshire sheds for 225,000 birds
text: a chicken farm in south shropshire should be approved , according to council officers .
author: South Shropshire Journal

documents.title: telford pantomime sets new record
text: this year 's telford pantomime was the most profitable yet , telford and wrekin council says .
there were 49 performances throughout december , with a number of dates being sold out and they included disability and family-friendly shows .
peter pan will be this year 's pantomime and tickets have already gone on sale .

documents.title: headlines : man dies in cressage crash ; care home closes after report ; record profits for panto
text: our headlines this evening :
- man dies and two in hospital after crash at cressage
- bishop 's castle care home closes the day after critical inspection report
- record profits for telford pantomime
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two in hospital following fatal crash
text: the ambulance service says it has taken a 62-year-old woman and a 76-year-old man to hospital following the crash at cressage in which the driver of an audi was killed .
the woman was the front seat passenger in the audi and is being treated for rib and pelvic pain .
the man , who was the driver of the land rover , was thrown from his vehicle and suffered head and facial injuries .

documents.title: breakingman dies in cressage crash
text: an elderly man has died in a crash at cressage involving a land rover and an audi .
the dead man had been travelling in the audi and he had to be cut free from the wreckage , while a woman he was travelling with was able to get out of the vehicle herself .
the driver of the land rover was thrown from his vehicle , but did n't suffer life-threatening injuries .
the fire service says the a458 between cressage and the weeping cross island in shrewsbury is likely to remain closed for some time .

documents.title: much-criticised bishop 's castle care home closes
text: a care home in bishop 's castle has shut , the day after it was heavily criticised by the care quality commission .
it was the second time in six months the grange on kerry lane was rated inadequate and shropshire council says all seven residents it had at the home were transferred before it closed .
the cqc inspectors found confidential patient information was n't protected , and repairs to rooms were not carried out .

a seriously injured patient was left without pain relief for 18 hours and another , unable support their own head , was n't given a reclining chair because there was only one and it was already being used .
we have attempted to contact the owners .

documents.title: football : hurst leaves afc telford united
text: the afc telford united defender james hurst has joined dover athletic .
telford cancelled his contract after disparaging remarks appeared on his twitter account .
manager rob smith and his assistant larry chambers are looking for a potential replacement .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: colleges to merge in august
text: new college and telford college of arts and technology in wellington say they 're on course to merge formally by the beginning of august
they say a new joint principal will be appointed next month and the plans are being checked-over by business experts from financial consultancy deloitte .
the proposals are then due to be opened up to consultation among staff , stakeholders , and students from the two colleges , in the spring .

documents.title: headlines : mp wants food production subsidies scrapped ; mansion demolition plan backed ; care home could close
text: our headlines this afternoon include :
- north shropshire mp wants to scrap food production subsidies for farmers
- councillor says partial demolition of listed mansion could be best option
- bishop 's castle care home threatened with closure by inspectors
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire fly-tippers avoid paying the penalty
text: shropshire 's two main councils have not issued any fines for fly-tipping since they were given new powers for `` on the spot '' penalties earlier this year , figures have revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury players expecting changes during transfer window
text: shrewsbury town 's joe riley says the players know there will be some new faces appearing in the january transfer window .
manager paul hurst has identified several targets who impressed when they played against his former side , grimsby , and is also a striker with a premier league connection .
with shrewsbury second-from-bottom , hurst has said he wants players who are willing to fight for the club .
we know as players we probably have n't performed to our abilities , so there have got to be changes and there will be i 'm sure . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: gritters returning as freezing temperatures forecast
text: the gritting lorries are going out again this afternoon , with temperatures forecast to drop below freezing overnight .
shropshire 's councils say their priority will be to treat main roads and access to important places like hospitals .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : complaints about narrow street being used as rat-run
text: people living on a narrow street in st martins say they want action taken to stop motorists using it as a cut-through .
kimberley lane is sign-posted for access only , but the residents say it is being treated as a rat run by cars travelling at speed .
last month , the police said they recieved `` numerous concerns and complaints '' about traffic using the street and nearby clark 's lane .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire mp wants to scrap food production payments to farmers
text: the conservative mp for north shropshire and former environment secretary owen paterson thinks payments for food production should be scrapped .
but mr paterson said farmers need to be compensated for the work they do for the environment .

the environmental audit committee has said new legislation is needed to keep important european safeguards in place and is warning that britain 's withdrawal from the eu could put the uk 's countryside , farming and wildlife at risk .
i would not reward food production , i would let farmers choose which crops to grow , which animals to raise according to the demands of the market .
where there is a clear justification for subsidy is compensating farmers and landowners for the public good they provide . ''

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : mbe for fundraiser tom
text: when tom kelly was notified he 'd been awarded the mbe , he thought he was being conned .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: telford council to make further cuts in 2017
text: the leader of telford and wrekin council says we should expect `` further cuts across the board '' this year , as it attempts to balance its budget .
councillor shaun davies blamed a reduction in funding from the government and said parish and town councils and other community groups would be asked to take over the running of some services .
mr davies said his authority was not `` dumping services on to communities '' and promised grants help ease the transfer of services .

documents.title: headlines : warning of more council cuts ; support for partial demolition of hall ; more time for dragon statue
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- telford council leader warns of more cuts in 2017
- councillor says partial demolition of listed hall could be best option
- businessman given more time to build giant dragon statue on welsh border
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: opposition to plans to build retail units and a cafe in bridgnorth
text: more than 100 local residents and bridgnorth town council have criticised plans to build four retail units and a cafe on land next to sainsbury 's at old smithfield .
they 're concerned there will be a lack of car parking and they 're worried that shops might draw shoppers away from the high street .
officers for shropshire council say the scheme should go ahead , as there 's no evidence the units would hinder the high street trade .
only two letters have been received supporting the planning application , which goes before shropshire council next week .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a cold afternoon and freezing temperatures to come
text: it 's going to be a chilly afternoon and temperatures are forecast to drop below freezing this evening .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: councillor says partial demolition could be best way to save listed hall
text: knocking down part of the grade ii listed brogyntyn hall near oswestry could be the only way to save it , according to the local shropshire and parish councillor david lloyd .

an online petition opposing the demolition of the service wing has been backed by nearly 800 people , but mr lloyd said that while it was a `` historic mansion with a proud history '' , the damage to the building was so severe the planned redevelopment could be the only way to bring it back into habitable use .

historic england has the building on its `` at risk '' register , saying rainwater and dry rot are the main threats and mr lloyd said that while he had once hoped it could be restored and turned into a hotel or conference centre , `` time has taken its toll '' .
the developers , pickstock , have declined to comment , but were granted permission to turn the hall into flats in 2015 and to build 50 homes within the grounds .
that included permission to demolish the hall 's service wing .

i think the only way it can be brought back into habitable use is by reducing the area of indoor floor and some sorting out of other outbuildings , some of which really frankly also should also be demolished , it could be tidied up into a more modernist reincarnation . ''

documents.title: plans for walking trail linking shrewsbury and swansea
text: supporters of the train service that runs between shrewsbury and swansea are preparing to start work on a long-distance walking trail , linking stations along the route .
the line depends to a large extent on tourism , so community groups have come up with a scheme to tempt more people to take walking holidays in the welsh countryside .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: student who drove in telford after smoking marijuana is banned
text: a university student caught behind the wheel with cannabis in his system has been handed a 12-month driving ban .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: businessman given extension to build dragon sculpture
text: businessman simon wingett , has been given a five-year extension to create a huge dragon sculpture on the shropshire border near chirk .
it would have a wingspan of 187ft , 10ft wider than the angel of the north .
the project was given the go-ahead a few years back , but councillors yesterday decided to grant an extension .
i got planning permission in the depth of the worst planning recession in living memory , in 2011 .
so the first three , four years of my planning permission was really rather difficult , if you had anything that was slightly unusual in the construction world .
and obviously building a landmark of this size and nature was . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : leukaemia appeal nears milestone ; opposition to hall demolition plans ; more time for dragon statue
text: our headlines this morning :
- telford boy 's leukaemia appeal reaches nearly £ 3,000
- almost 800 people object to plans to demolish part of listed hall near oswestry
- businessman given more time to build giant dragon sculpture on welsh border
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: revised supermarket plans fail to win over objectors
text: people who opposed plans for an out-of-town supermarket in ludlow say they 're still against the idea , after a meeting to discuss revised plans last night .
developers have come up with a slightly smaller scheme , which has been submitted to shropshire council , although its still unclear which supermarket chain would run the store .
the objectors are concerned it will draw shoppers away from the town centre , but the company behind the proposal for rocks green says it would have little impact .
part of the problem is they do n't have a client in place , so all the figures they 've drawn on vary hugely , depending on whether it 's going to be an aldi or a waitrose .
that 's what makes it very hard to gauge in terms of what pull they 'll take from the town centre . ''

documents.title: finding a lost friend in a huge crowd
text: finding a lost friend in a huge crowd
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: boy 's leukemia appeal reaches almost £ 3k
text: an appeal to raise money for a telford family , whose five-year-old son has been diagnosed with a rare form of leukemia , has reached almost £ 3k .
liam finazee , from malinslee , was diagnosed with burkitt 's lymphoma , just before christmas and has spent the festive period undergoing treatment at birmingham children 's hospital .
his aunt rebecca kendal launched the crowd funding appeal on just giving , to help the family pay for car parking charges at the hospital .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire 's a & es see patient numbers nearly double
text: a & e departments in shropshire have seen patient numbers almost double , despite appeals for people to stay away .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: hundreds sign petition to save grade ii listed hall near oswestry
text: almost 800 people have signed an online petition against plans to demolish part of a grade ii listed hall near oswestry .
brogyntyn hall was abandoned in the mid 1980s .
dry rot and rainwater are at risk of destroying it and it 's currently on historic england 's at risk register .
in 2015 , planning permission was granted to demolish the service wing and change the hall from office to residential use .
the plans include turning home farm into 11 dwellings and the building of 50 houses in the grounds - but there 's been little progress since
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp secures debate on future of a & e units in the county
text: shrewsbury 's mp daniel kawczynski has secured a short commons debate on the future of shropshire 's accident and emergency units next week .
health bosses have stalled on a controversial recommendation to base a single emergency unit in shrewsbury .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : commons debate on future of a & e units ; fight against out-of-town supermarket rumbles on
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- shrewsbury mp secures commons debate on future of a & e units
- campaigners still opposed to out-of-town supermarket in ludlow even though it would now be smaller
- businessman given an extension to build dragon sculpture near chirk .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: a chilly start with cloudy skies during the morning and the odd spot of rain .
it will become sunnier in the afternoon though .
top temperatures of 6c ( 43f )
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : roadworks may slow your journey
text: no major problems to report of on the county 's roads this morning , but roadworks may delay your journey .
traffic is slow on the a518 new trench road in telford at the clock tower roundabout in the roadworks .
for more information visit the bbc travel page .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm here with all of your news , sport , travel and weather updates this morning .
do get in touch if you have a story or you 'd like to share with the rest of the county .
you can email , tweet , or get in touch via our facebook page .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman sold sexual of 'lotto gran '
text: woman sold sexual of 'lotto gran '

documents.title: weather : a cloudy end to the day and freezing weather to come
text: it 's going to be a cloudy end to the day and we 're forecast some freezing weather over the next few days .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: commons debate on shropshire a & e proposals
text: shrewsbury 's mp daniel kawczynski has secured a short commons debate on the future of shropshire 's accident and emergency units next week .

mr kawczynski has been in favour of nhs proposals for a single emergency unit in shrewsbury and expressed his frustration when the plans had to be put on hold just before christmas , to allow further work to be carried out .

documents.title: flooding warning over lightmoor homes plan
text: plans for 52 new homes on the site of the old lightmoor concrete works in telford go before a council planning committee next week .

dawley hamlets parish council has expressed concern , saying the site `` repeatedly floods '' , but a report drawn up by planning officials at telford and wrekin council suggests the homes can be safely built away from the worst-affected areas .
the recommendation going before councillors is to approve the application , subject to a number of conditions , including a donation of £ 121,131 to pay for new classrooms at the local school .

documents.title: oswestry mother calls on public to sign up to register
text: a family is urging others to make their new year resolution to sign up to the organ donation register to help children like their son survive .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your comments : memories of percy the peacock
text: the story about the death of percy the peacock has got you talking on our facebook page .

it had lived at oswestry 's orthopaedic hospital for over 20 years and richard field wrote : `` when i was in having an operation he used to sleep outside up on the warm pipes just outside my window .
it was lovely to see him come wandering around in the evening just before he jumped up onto his perch . ''
sarah burbidge also remembers percy , writing : `` he startled me the first day of my nurse training at oswestry .
heard him screeching on a night shift .
percy will be missed . ''
and julia finch added , `` so sad , i have found him fascinating when i have had to attend the hospital over the years . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : busiest day for ambulance service ; arrest after knife attack ; stable fire is suspected arson
text: our headlines this evening :
- ambulance service reports busiest day on record
- arrest after telford hammer and knife attack on 65-year-old
- wellington stable fire is suspected arson
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager questions loan-striker 's commitment
text: shrewsbury town 's manager has suggested loan-striker ivan toney was n't completely committed to the cause , during his spell at the club .
paul hurst decided not to renew the loan with newcastle united , saying he wanted players `` who want to be here '' .
the 6ft 2in striker was brought to shrewsbury by former manager micky mellon and he scored six times .
ivan will be going back and i think that he 's had that in his mind unfortunately for a little while .
i think he 'll go back and then go elsewhere , but as i 've said i want people who want to be here , so i 'm not going to lose sleep over it . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : mushrooms and crescent moon
text: not all the photos we get from the bbc weather watchers are of the weather .
this of a mushroom was taken by a regular contributor from newport , who uses the nickname tay .
and did you see the bright crescent moon last night ?
another of the weather watchers , who uses the nickname biker don , took this photo in horsehay .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: stable fire is suspected arson
text: a fire which destroyed a stable block in wellington on new year 's day is being treated as arson .
six engines were called to orleton hall at 02:33 and they were there for nearly five hours .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the fa people 's cup is back - sign up now ! # peoplescup
text: looking for a new project for the start of 2017 ?
how about getting fit/fitter with a chance to win free tickets to the fa cup final ?

get inspired has again teamed up with the football association to launch the 2017 fa people 's cup , a free knockout competition that will give the people of england the chance to play in their version of the fa cup .
from sunday league regulars to folk who have only kicked a ball in their back yard everyone can take part .
find out more and sign up here .

documents.title: arrest following telford knife and hammer attack
text: a 20-year-old man has been arrested in connection with an attack on a 65-year-old man in the sutton hill area of telford on 28 december .
police were called to a report of three men , armed with a hammer and knife , who assaulted the man before making off with money and possessions from the property , including a knife and two coats .
the arrested man is from the hadley area of telford and has been released on police bail until 1 february .

documents.title: walker airlifted from long mynd after breaking ankle
text: a hill walker has been airlifted to hospital after falling in frosty conditions and breaking her ankle on the long mynd .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : call for a & e decision ; no funding for new gp surgery ; supermarket meeting in ludlow
text: our headlines this afternoon include :
- ambulance boss calls for end to a & e uncertainty
- no nhs funding for new gp surgery in shifnal
- supermarket meeting to be held in ludlow
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: school closure caused by heating failure
text: it 's going to be cold over the next few days and meole brace secondary school is going to be closed tomorrow - it 's having problems with its heating .
due to issues with the heating system , meole brace school ( secondary ) will be closed on wednesday 4 january .

documents.title: 'smart ' insulin could reduce injections
text: 'smart ' insulin could reduce injections
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: busiest ever new year 's day for ambulance service
text: new year 's day was the busiest days ever for the ambulance service which covers shropshire .
west midlands ambulance service received 4,629 calls - that 's more than three a minute and 807 more calls than the previous busiest day , 1 january 2011 .
around half of the calls came from birmingham and black country , but there were 244 calls made in shropshire on 1 january and call-numbers were up throughout christmas week .
the out-of-hours advice service shropdoc also had an extremely busy christmas , taking more than a thousand calls a day at the peak of demand .
it 's been a hugely challenging christmas period and there 's no sign that january is going to be any less busy . ''

documents.title: ambulance boss calls for end to a & e uncertainty
text: a west midlands ambulance service chief says he would like to see the reorganisation of shropshire 's hospitals speeded up .

proposals to create just one emergency centre in the county , which could result in a number of other departments moving between shrewsbury and telford , have stalled following concerns about the decision-making process .

mark docherty , the clinical commissioning director at wmas , says he can see no problem with the idea of having just one emergency centre , but believes the uncertainty surrounding the three-year future fit review is frustrating for people .
i think a lot of people are frustrated we have n't got an answer , because actually once we 've got an answer we can all start to safely work towards that solution . ''

documents.title: football : telford striker hibbert out for a month
text: afc telford united expect to be without dave hibbert for a month .
the striker up a thigh strain in the bucks ' new year game at alfreton .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fire alarm cuts short broadcast
text: were you watching midlands today at 13:30 ?
here they are with the reason for an abridged broadcast :
we have returned inside - all deemed safe .
apologies you got an abridged 1.30 @ twitterid but better safe than sorry # firealarm
wondered why you disappeared !
apologies for loss of @ twitterid we 've had to switch to news channel as we 've had to evacuate the offices due to fire alarm .
hope it was a false alarm and all is well at the mailbox .
why not switch to east midlands today , rather than the news channel .
@ twitterid ooh , is there a clip ?
good point .
what midlanders do we know who might 've caught it ?
and i was beginning to think it was cos it was a slow news day
@ twitterid and @ twitterid for your info
thank you for the update
had a bit of a hot news item , did you ?
i hope everyone 's ok ?

documents.title: new canal boat to be built for ellesmere tours
text: the lyneal trust , which runs canal boat rides for the elderly and disabled in ellesmere , is building a new boat this year .
the trust says its existing boat , the shropshire lad ( above ) is getting a bit old and the new boat will be more comfortable and have better visibility for passengers .
it 'll also have a pa system for tours .

documents.title: shrewsbury town sign hartlepool united defender
text: shrewsbury town have signed hartlepool united defender aristote nsiala on a two-and-a-half-year contract for an undisclosed fee .
the 24-year-old becomes boss paul hurst 's first signing at shrewsbury and previously played for him at grimsby .
nsiala left the mariners to join pools in june and has made 25 appearances this season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : frosty and cloudy scenes from around shropshire
text: it 's been another chilly start to the day and that can be seen in photos taken around the county by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near ludlow ( top ) and newport ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: supermarket meeting to be held in ludlow
text: a meeting is taking place in ludlow tonight to discuss plans for a new supermarket at rocks green .
it 's been called because revised plans have been submitted by the developers .

town councillors have previously said they 'll seek legal advice to prevent the store from being built , arguing it will take trade out of the town centre , but the firm behind the plans insist it will have little impact on ludlow 's independent shops .
the meeting 's scheduled for 18:00 at the women 's centre , off church walk .

documents.title: headlines : ambulance boss wants hospitals decision ; no cash for gp surgery ; hospital peocock dies
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- ambulance boss calls for end to a & e uncertainty
- no funding for new shifnal medical practice from nhs england
- hospital peacock dies of old age
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: motorists welcome plans to allow learners to drive on motorways
text: plans to allow learner drivers to drive on motorways have been welcomed by motorists in shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : cold and cloudy for the remainder of the day
text: it 's going to be cold , with thick cloud overhead for the rest of the day , but it should be relatively mild overnight .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: warning over planned roadworks
text: letters are being sent across the oswestry area warning people of long-term closures and potential hold-ups on the a5 .
overnight work lasting nearly six months will start monday 16 january , involving closures and diversions on the road north of the st martins/weston rhyn roundabout at gledrid .
there 'll also be speed restrictions and temporary traffic lights .

documents.title: hospital peacock dies of old age
text: a peacock which has lived at oswestry 's orthopaedic hospital for over 20 years has died .
the robert jones and agnes hunt hospital said percy was taken ill just before christmas and appeared to have made a recovery , but passed away yesterday .

percy has been entertaining staff and patients since flying in from nearby park hall , but the hospital said `` old age seems to have caught up with him in the end '' and that he will be `` fondly remembered '' .
percy had become something of a legend here at rjah over the years .
he will be sadly missed but very fondly remembered . ''

documents.title: drop in number of people detained for mental health reasons
text: there 's been a significant drop in the number of people kept in police cells for mental health reasons in west mercia .
a bbc investigation reveals it went down by 95 % between 2010 and 2015 - and there are now calls for it to stop completely .
during that time , the number of people detained under the mental health act dropped from more than 300 to 15 - the youngest person detained was 12 years old .
the charity rethink mental illness is calling for the practice to be stopped completely .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ambulance service wo n't object to hospital plans
text: west midlands ambulance service says it wo n't object if shropshire 's hospitals end up with just one emergency care centre - but it might need more money .

a review of hospital services in the county has suggested downgrading the a & e department in either telford or shrewsbury and moving all emergency medicine to the other site , saying this would be better for patient care and make it easier to recruit staff .
mark docherty , the clinical commissioning director at wmas said he was confident it could provide a safe service , but if it has to transport patients further , it will need paying more .
we 'd have to look at a different type of payment system , because the current system takes account that we go to the nearest hospital .
so if we are travelling greater distances , we would have to be recompensed appropriately . ''

documents.title: no money for new medical practice
text: shifnal 's hopes of getting a new medical practice have been dealt a blow , because nhs england has decided not to offer any funding .

the developers behind the soon-to-be-built haughton road housing estate have set aside a plot of land for the building and an application was made for the funding through shropshire 's clinical commissioning group .
the shropshire forward community group says that the failure of the bid is n't the end of the road though and it will now look for other sources of funding .

documents.title: a jolt for the electric car industry
text: a jolt for the electric car industry
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: headlines : drop in people held under mental health act ; university id stolen ; ambulance service backs a & e plan
text: our top stories this morning :
- drop in number of people detained by police for mental health reasons
- university hit by fraudsters
- plan to have main a & e unit in shrewsbury backed by county 's ambulance service
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : loan spell not renewed for ivan toney
text: ivan toney is not having his loan spell at shrewsbury town from newcastle renewed .
the loan ends today and his return to the north east has been hastened by town 's dismal defeat by fleetwood yesterday .
the future of other loanees whose deals are up imminently will also be under scrutiny .
town 's manager paul hurst has various targets in the january transfer window - but insists he wo n't be rash in signing players for the sake of it .
what i 'm not going to do is get desperate so i 've got to be patient . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: university hit by fraudsters
text: the university of wolverhampton , which has a campus in telford , is one of a number of universities that 's had its identity stolen by fraudsters offering fake degrees .
forty websites have been shut down in a major crackdown on the sale of false qualifications .
degree certificates were copied so they looked like the genuine article .

documents.title: west mercia police catches 95,000 drivers speeding in the last year
text: almost 95,000 drivers have been caught speeding under the police force that covers shropshire , it has been revealed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury slip up in first game of 2017
text: shrewsbury town missed out on the chance to pull clear of the league one relegation zone with an out-of-sorts home display against fleetwood on monday .
the town lost 1-0 to an early goal - and rarely looked like getting one themselves .
there were few chances for either team in the second half , although substitute ashley hunter curled a shot from just outside the box narrowly over for the visitors .
shrewsbury have now slipped to 23rd in league one .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather warning for ice issued
text: a weather warning for ice remains in place until 10:00 says the met office .
untreated pavement and minor roads are likely to be very slippery with a few freezing fog patches also likely .

documents.title: watch : tuesday 's weather forecast
text: a frosty start to the day , cloudy with the odd spot of rain too .
sara has the details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : mental health arrests down ; a5 delay warning ; meeting to discuss ludlow supermarket
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- significant drop in number of people kept in police cells for mental health reasons in west mercia
- commuters across oswestry warned of delays during a5 roadworks
- plans for an out-of-town supermarket in ludlow to be discussed at meeting tonight
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning from bbc radio shropshire
text: i 'm in the newsroom taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you have a story or you 'd like to share , you can email us or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live
